item.title: 2 potholes adjoining about 18‚Äù each, 12th August
item.description:

item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Dog fouling, litter/fly-tipping, and overgrown vegetation, 12th August
item.description:
Over the past month the condition of Alleyway 35 has deteriorated significantly: Dog fouling ‚Äì Large amounts along the path, making it hazardous for pedestrians (especially children, buggies, and elderly residents). The smell is unpleasant, and it‚Äôs a public health concern. Signs warning of fines for not picking up after dogs have been removed and should be reinstated. Litter/fly-tipping ‚Äì Ongoing issue with rubbish and dumped items, which is attracting vermin. Overgrown vegetation ‚Äì Trees and hedges along the alleyway are unkempt and blocking parts of the path. This alleyway is an important pedestrian route for Hill Close residents. Please arrange an inspection and action to: - Remove dog waste and litter. - Reinstate dog fouling warning signage and consider enforcement. - Clear overgrown vegetation. The standard of maintenance has declined noticeably over the past six months. Public safety risk: Yes ‚Äì obstruction of pathway, trip hazards, and health hazard from waste.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Telegraph Path, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard caused by digging, 12th August
item.description:
The pavement outside number 7 Queenswood Road was dug up a few days ago to repair broken and uneven paving slabs. Tarmac was laid to replace these but unfortunately the digging has disturbed large areas of concrete. This is now sticking up to a height of approximately 2cm, potentially causing a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queenswood Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nw6 5pt, 12th August
item.description:
I have already repotted this twice. Two large mattresses, a large barbecue, kitchen cupboard, bed . I managed to dispose of some of the items myself, but I can't touch the mattresses and barbecue. It is outrageous that this has still not been dealt with!!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Mews, London
